summary: A business app for a silk saree business called KBR Silks. Includes features for managing and showcasing silk sarees, with catalog, orders, and customer management.

existing_features.title: Design and apply a rich, elegant visual theme inspired by traditional Indian textiles — deep jewel tones (crimson, gold, ivory, deep teal), ornate typography, subtle silk-texture motifs, and a regal layout — enforced consistently across all pages.

Create a Saree Catalog page that displays all sarees in a responsive grid. Each card shows the saree image, name, fabric type, color, price, and available stock. Include a search bar to filter by name or fabric type.
Create an Admin panel for managing the saree catalog — with forms to add a new saree (all fields), edit an existing saree, and delete a saree with a confirmation prompt.

Create an Orders management page in the admin panel that lists all orders in a table with columns for order ID, customer name, phone, total price, date, and status. Allow the admin to change the status of any order via a dropdown.

Create a Customers page in the admin panel that lists all customers in a table showing name, phone, email, address, and order count. Include the ability to add a new customer and edit existing customer details via a modal form.

Build a navigation structure with a top header showing the brand name 'Silk Splendor' and a sidebar or tab navigation for: Catalog (public view), and Admin sections — Manage Sarees, Orders, and Customers.

Update the brand name displayed in the app header and all other locations from 'Silk Splendor' to 'KBR Silks'. This includes the top header in Layout.tsx, the HTML page title in index.html, and any other visible references to the old brand name throughout the UI.

new_feature_requests.summary: Silk saree product catalog with images and details

Build a backend data model for silk saree products, storing: name, description, fabric type (e.g., Kanjivaram, Banarasi, Mysore), color, price, stock quantity, and an image URL. Support CRUD operations: add, update, delete, and list all products.

Build a backend data model for orders. Each order stores: customer name, customer phone, list of ordered saree IDs with quantities, total price, order date, and status (Pending / Confirmed / Shipped / Delivered). Support operations: place order, update status, list all orders, and get order by ID.

Build a backend data model for customers storing: name, phone number, email (optional), address, and total orders count. Support operations: add customer, update customer info, list all customers, and get customer by ID.
